Danger.Summary: The company may share your information with third-party platforms for advertising and promotions. This raises privacy concerns and may potentially lead to unsolicited ads.
Danger.ClauseSection: Information from Advertising and Marketing Partners

Danger.Summary: The company may share your information with third parties to detect, prevent or prosecute illegal activity. This allows for the potential wide dissemination of your personal data.
Danger.ClauseSection: To share information with law enforcement and respond to legal requests

Danger.Summary: Etsy shares user information with third parties for investigations or regulatory inquiries. This can involve data sharing and excessive data collection, posing potential privacy concerns.
In case of business reorganization, Etsy may transfer user information as one of the business assets. This implies a potential data sharing or selling to third parties without explicit user consent.
Etsy, based on user's consent, can utilize various user data for marketing purposes. This may potentially involve excessive data collection beyond application context.

Etsy uses data to personalize the experience on the Sites and Apps for users in the European Region. This can involve collection of General Location Information, which is categorized as potentially invasive.
Collects device-based precise location to personalize services, delivery, and shipping.
Shares your information with regulators, law enforcement or others where necessary to perform a task in the public interest like combating unlawful or harmful behavior.
Danger.ClauseSection: Data used for tasks carried out in the public interest

Danger.Summary: Sharing your data with third parties for the purposes of performing services, legal operations or compliance with the privacy policy.

Your reviews, account information, device information, etc. can be shared on search engines, third-party platforms, and within Etsy Group Companies. Sellers can know your buying habits and third parties connected to your Etsy account receive certain information about you. Business partners involved in facilitating transactions also need to share information related to the transaction. This increases the risk of your data being accessed by unauthorized parties or used for unacceptable purposes.

The clause indicates that your personal information may be shared with advisors, consultants, regulators, tax authorities, law enforcement, government agencies, civil litigants, and industry partners. This raises a danger as this would mean data being shared outside the companyv could possibly be misused or mishandled.

The clause advises that in the event of a business reorganization, such as a sale, merger, liquidation, receivership, your information may be one of the transferred business assets. There's potential risk as your information may be transferred to a party that has different privacy standards.

The section states that Etsy shares your information with a list of third-party service providers such as research companies, analytics services, security providers, etc. The range of shared information is expansive which could lead to excessive data collection beyond the scope of the application.
Etsy transfers personal information to different locations, including countries with different privacy laws and standards, in order to deliver the services.
Danger.ClauseSection: To the extent that Etsy is deemed to transfer personal information

Danger.Summary: Google reCAPTCHA Enterprise collects hardware and software information from users for security purposes and to help prevent spam, fraud, and abuse.
Danger.ClauseSection: We use Google reCAPTCHA Enterprise in connection with our Services

Danger.Summary: The company keeps your information as long as necessary to provide their services, maintain performance, security, and keeping business and financial records. The retention period is based on general rules, consent and contractual obligations.
Etsy will retain and use your information to fulfill legal obligations such as KYC and tax laws.
Danger.ClauseSection: Use of information for regulatory compliance

Danger.Summary: Personal data may be retained for other legitimate purposes such as preventing harm, investigating violations, promoting safety, security and integrity or to protect the company's rights and platform.
Danger.ClauseSection: Information used for other legitimate purposes

Danger.Summary: The clause mentions sharing user information with other group companies, trusted partners, and service providers. This is a risky practice as user data may be misused, sold, or lost during these exchanges.

Many different types of personal and financial information are collected when a user signs up for an account or uses the services. This includes name, email, phone number, payment information, delivery address, regional info etc. This can be considered an overreach and represent a breach of privacy.
Danger.ClauseSection: Section 1, Information You Provide to Us

Danger.Summary: The service tracks your location based on the information you provide in your profile and seller public profile. This could be used for excessive data collection beyond the scope of the application.
The service gathers information about your favorite items, stores, product reviews and linked third-party accounts which can be shared with other individuals on the platform or third parties.
The service collects your credit or debit card information or other payment method. This could be used for financial tracking.
The service collects information about your transactions such as the items purchased, purchase price, and date of the transaction. This information might be used for excessive data collection
The service allows access to your camera for uploading photographs and videos. This could be used for gathering additional data from your device outside the scope of the application.
By uploading photos and videos or posting content in community spaces, you potentially give the service license to use your content.
Collection of a wide array of information, some of which may be deemed excessive such as demographic information and business income breakdown.
The platform automatically collects information from the user's browser or device when they interact with the website or apps, infringing on the privacy of the user.
Danger.ClauseSection: Information We Collect Automatically - Browser and Device Information

Danger.Summary: The service tracks how often users use the Apps, how they interact with the Services, which can infringe on users' privacy.
General location data is used to tailor services and estimate shipping costs. Constant tracking could be an infringement on user privacy.
The company keeps track of your IP addresses, your general and precise location.
The company receives information about you from third parties, including details from payment processors like Paypal.
Danger.ClauseSection: Information We Receive from Third Parties

Danger.Summary: The company uses third-party software to record information such as how often you use the Site and/or Apps, your interaction with their services, performance data and app errors.

The clause suggests that when you link our services with third-party applications, they receive your contact information and any additional information you authorize the third party to share with us, which might include delicate data.
The clause indicates the collection of information about a Non-Member in connection with certain features. This data collection might reach beyond the actual usage purpose.
The clause suggests that certain information will be shared with third-party partners – such as shipping and payment partners – risking privacy.
Danger.ClauseSection: Facilitating Buying and Selling on Etsy

Danger.Summary: The clause indicates that there's collection of general location data, potentially unveiling user's location
This part entails details on financial transactions hence potential tracking of financial information
Etsy may use, preserve, or release your personal information to a third party to comply with legal and regulatory obligations.
Danger.ClauseSection: To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

Danger.Summary: In the process of complying with legal and regulatory obligations, Etsy might collect and use your general location information.
Danger.ClauseSection: To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

Danger.Summary: Tracks general location information for exploring ways to develop and grow their business.
Collects various types of data including service usage, browser and device information, customer support information and cookie information.
Uses service usage, browser and device information, and shop preferences to rank search results and customize services.
Collects location and buyer profile information when providing advertising.

Caution.Summary: The company may apply automated processing and manual review on your data to maintain security and integrity, and even detect violations of the company's terms of use. This could potentially lead to account suspension without further explanation.
Caution.ClauseSection: To keep our Services safe and secure

Caution.InfringementKeyword: No right to know why a company is suspending or flagging accounts
Caution.Summary: The company states it may use your data to protect and exercise its legal rights or to resolve disputes. This suggests there might be no explicit right for users to know why their accounts are flagged or suspended.

Etsy uses user's consent to personalize ads on third-party platforms and sites. It involves using their data to create targeted ads, which can be concerning if a user is not comfortable with their data being used for such purposes.
Certain information about users like public profile details, join date, reviewed items, purchased items etc are publicly displayed and shared via social networks.

If you connect your Etsy account to a third-party application, the providers of those services receive certain information about you. Also, you're subjected to the third-party service provider's terms and privacy policy, which Etsy has no control over and might not be in alignment with Etsy's data standards and safety measures.

The clause states that by using their services, you acknowledge that your information will be used in the United States, Ireland, and any other country where Etsy operates. As such there can be legal implications as data protection laws vary between countries.
Personal information is transferred and stored outside of the user's home country as part of the contract with Etsy.
Caution.ClauseSection: As we operate in countries worldwide and use technical infrastructure in the US

Caution.Summary: Based on your location, your data may be controlled by a service provider located in another country. This can lead to potential jurisdictional issues, differing privacy laws, or slower response times for resolving issues.
Caution.ClauseSection: Approximately third paragraph from the beginning

Caution.Summary: Data collected from your profile and seller public profile, including favorite items and stores, may be used to create targeted ads.
Data collected throughout the use of the service, including messages and promotional participation, may be stored in another country.
The company receives certain information about you from advertising and marketing partners, including the marketing content you have viewed or clicked, responses to offers, and audience information.
Caution.ClauseSection: Information from Advertising and Marketing Partners

Caution.Summary: The company might use user's data to personalize content for their benefit.

Caution.InfringementKeyword: Our Services are subject to laws
Caution.Summary: The clause implies that the company will comply with laws potentially leading to termination of an account without reason
While Etsy relies on legitimate interests to use your personal information in certain cases, the details of these interests are not explicitly stated, which could be concerning.
Service usage, browser and device information, and general location information are used to show personalized ads and promote sellers.
Your information may be used to display non-personalized ads on third-party platforms and sites.

Safety.Summary: These sections of the policy indicate that users have certain rights regarding their personal information and the company will inform them about updates on their privacy policy. This is considered safe as users have some control and will be kept informed.
Safety.ClauseSection: 7. Your Rights & Choices, 9. Privacy Policy Changes

Safety.Summary: The company suggests it has measures to keep data safe and secure. However, it is not explicitly stated that data is encrypted.
Safety.ClauseSection: To keep our Services safe and secure

Safety.Summary: The company implies that they will make efforts to prevent spam, abuse, harm, and other violations, and likely update users about these. However, no explicit statement is made about informing users of updates to terms and conditions.
Safety.ClauseSection: To keep our Services safe and secure

Safety.Summary: The clause mentions that Etsy will notify you by email or by putting a notice on the Site and the Apps if it intends to transfer information about you. This ensures transparency and allows you to take necessary action, if needed.

Etsy uses technical and administrative measures to protect personal information from unlawful, unauthorized, or destructive access, and encourages users to enhance account security through strong passwords and two-factor authentication.
Etsy retains your information only as long as necessary for the purposes outlined in the Policy, while the account is active, or to comply with legal obligations.
Safety.ClauseSection: How Long We Store Your Information

Safety.Summary: Users have the right to access, edit or remove certain information. They can request a copy of their personal data, rectify inaccurate info and transmit particular information to another controller.
Users have the right to receive their information in a structured and commonly used format.
Users have the right to request for rectification of inaccurate information about them.

Safety.InfringementKeyword: Right to Restrict Processing, Right to Deletion, Right to Object, Right to Withdraw Consent, Right to File a Complaint
Safety.Summary: This is about the user's right to control their data. They can restrict how their data is used, ask for it to be deleted, object to certain types of processing, and they have the right to withdraw their consent at any time. They are also allowed to file a complaint about how their data is handled.
You can opt out from receiving marketing emails. The privacy policy can be updated regularly and users will be notified of these changes via email or message.
Provides options to ask questions including email and physical address, which gives users means to assert their data privacy rights.
As a buyer, you have the freedom to edit, remove, or limit your profile information through the account settings. This practice enhances user safety.
You have control over personal information shared on your profile and seller public profile, and you can remove, limit or edit this information through your account settings.
The user has the opportunity to choose what information they provide in cases like surveys, research, and feedback mechanisms, providing some control over data sharing.
The company uses your precise geo-location only where you have given them permission to do so through your device-based settings.
The clause implies that certain information will be collected to set up your Etsy account and allow you to interact with the Etsy Community only after the user's consent.
Safety.ClauseSection: Creating and Maintaining your Etsy account

Safety.InfringementKeyword: To promote the safety, security and integrity of our Services
Safety.Summary: This clause indicates the use of data to promote user's security on the platform
The clause informs that the company will inform the users about updates and changes. This promotes transparency and allows the user to stay informed
Etsy explains in detail the categories of data they use and how this data is used, including complying with local laws, verifying your identity, and improving services.
Safety.ClauseSection: Why and How We Use Your Information
